Message.Title: Samsung Q2 profit misses analysts estimates on S4 smartphone
Message.Msg: SOURCE: Bloomberg just in "“It sharply missed the market expectation, and that worries me,” said Byun Han Joon, a Seoul-based analyst at KB Investment & Securities Co. “The market was initially concerned about the third- and fourth-quarter results, but today’s news raises questions if the earnings are already in bad shape.” Byun said smartphone shipments for the quarter totaled 74 million, or 2 million less than he expected. Shares Slump"" ...... ::“Apple is suffering from iPhone fatigue, while Samsung is suffering from Galaxy fatigue,” Neil Mawston, executive director of Strategy Analytics, said in an e-mail before the release.""

Message.Title: OUYA OUTSOLD XBOX ONE VIA AMAZON IN CANADA
Message.Msg: SOURCE: .game-debate 09:42 Jul-04-2013 Currently, on Canada's Amazon page, the PS4 sits at the #1, most-sold item. No surprise there, right? Right. Then, there's the bigger surprise up at #2. The Ouya. That's right, the Ouya is the #2 most-sold item via Amazon, in Canada. Now that, is a big surprise. and then, of course, at #3, theres the highly-anticipated, award-winning, The Last of Us, an Exclusive for the PS3, and again, like the PS4, no surprise there. and then, there's the one friend that nobody likes, The Xbox One, down at #4 for most sold via Amazon in Canada. So, I wonder how that makes Microsoft feel, right? An Android Market based console, has beaten the Xbox One. It's official. I now completely understand why Don Mattrick decided to jump on the 24/7 tomato-planting bandwagon and become CEO of Zynga. You 'dun goof'd, Microsoft. You 'dun goof'd. ______ Yeah, you 'dun goof'd, Ballmer!

Message.Title: "NVIDIA’s Tegra 4 not selling as fast as expected"
Message.Msg: "NVIDIA’s Tegra 4 not selling as fast as expected" "Recent successes by mobile processor makers such a Qualcomm and the Taiwanese fab-less semiconductor company MediaTek seem to be putting pressure on the sales of NVIDIA's latest ARM based processor the Tegra 4. Although NVIDIA has managed to attract some big clients for its new processor, it seems that the high price of the SoC is causing some of its partners to wait for the cheaper Tegra 4i which also has the benefit of the integrated i500 LTE modem. According to upstream suppliers which have spoken to the Digitimes, shipment volumes of the Tegra 4 are limited. The Tegra 4, which was announced at the beginning of this year, is a quad-core Cortex-A15 design which, like the Tegra 3, also features a extra 5th companion core for use in ultra low power situations with the other cores shutdown. Running at a maximum speed of 1.9GHz the chip is manufactured by TSMC using a 28nm process. ..." source: android authority

Message.Title: Even this Nvidia fan thinks Windows RT will Fail and QCOM spanked Nvidia.
Message.Msg: "My readers know that I think Windows RT (that is, Windows tablets that run only the Windows RT OS) is damned to burn in the fiery pits of software hell. It literally offers no advantages over an Intel powered Windows 8 tablet; not in battery life, not in performance, and certainly not in flexibility. The only "enterprise" users of the ill-fated Surface RT are the poor souls at ARM itself, and the rest of the world will be enjoying full Windows 8.1, "Bay Trail" tablets/cheap notebooks by the end of the year. In short, if Windows tablets become popular, then this means a broad tablet market share shift in favor of either Intel or AMD (AMD). Not so great for ARM's multiple. Further, Intel will also be playing in the Android tablet space with its Bay Trail part, although I suspect that ARM's licensee Qualcomm (QCOM) will do its damnest to keep Intel Outside of the Android tablet turf that it worked so diligently to steal from Nvidia (NVDA). The Nexus 7 goes to Qualcomm, but there's a chance the next gen Nexus 10 goes to Intel (although I wouldn't bet my money on that one this round). " source: Ashraf Eassa.writing for seekingalpha

Message.Title: Why Qualcomm continues its slide....
Message.Msg: In phones: All 3 major customers (constituting 80% of the high-end market) have lowered outlook for the near-term and intermediate term: --AAPL: inventories of iphone swell, iphone fatigue spreading --Samsung: stock already plummeted 15% in Seoul, S4 not moving nearly as fast at predicted --HTC: reported earnings/revenues shortfalls last night --the high-end phone market reportedly approaching SATURATION. Since Qualcomm already commands most of this market, additional design wins means NOTHING - it just means that one new product cannibalizes an old product, and no new revenues possible. In tablets: --Other than the alleged Nexus 7 secoond-gen, there appear to be no major design wins for QC in this market sector. It goes to show that entry barriers are much higher for the tablet/PC space (which QC is trying to break into) than for the phones (which NVIDIA has already made significant inroads).

Message.Title: Why hasn't Nvidia joined the HSA Foundation?
Message.Msg: ARM, Imagination Tech, Qualcomm, Texas Inst., AMD, Samsung and MediaTek are all members. What happens when these outfits starts shipping HSA 64 Bit ARM SoC in 2014 for phones, tablets and servers and Nvidia is still offering the old cut-n-paste from GPU GDDR5 to CPU DDR3 and back again architecture? Do all the about compaines have it wrong while Nvidia has it right? Intel is the other holdout but giess what? Intel has no plans to sell a 64 Bit ARM SoC. Nvidia is the ONLY ARM SoC vendor including ARM who doesn't get it. Why is Nvidia the odd ball outfit? Is it because an Nvidia rival is leading the way with a better idea? lol Remember Intel telling the world that AMD64 was not needed and 32 Bit x86 was just fine? Intel said if you want 64 Bit then use Itanium didn't they? Intel said they would not use AMD64 didn't they? How did NOT signing on to AMD64 work out for Intel? After a market share adjustment and an Intel attitude adjustment the Giant Intel gave in to the BETTER IDEA advanced by its rival didn't it? Nvidia is no Giant but the HSA Foundation has members who are, members that have no problem working with an Nvidia rival. An Nvidia rival that forced Giant Intel climb down off that Itanium horse and follow the AMD64 lead. lol HSA is about to run over Nvidia and Tegra just like AMD64 ran over Intel and Itanium. imho
